Package bricker.brick_strategies

Class ExtraBallsStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • bricker.brick_strategies.BasicCollisionStrategy
      • bricker.brick_strategies.ExtraBallsStrategy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CollisionStrategy
    public class ExtraBallsStrategy
extends BasicCollisionStrategy
    ExtraBallsStrategy is a specialized collision strategy that extends BasicCollisionStrategy. This class is specifically designed for adding extra balls into the game upon certain collision events, thereby increasing the challenge and dynamic nature of the gameplay. The strategy, when triggered by a collision, leads to the creation of additional balls, adding complexity and excitement to the game. It is a part of the game's strategy to diversify the player's experience. Usage: - Instantiate this class with the necessary game components. - Attach this strategy to a GameObject. - On collision, the strategy will be triggered to add extra balls into the game.
    Version:
    Java 11
    Author:
    Noam Shabat, Samuel Hayat

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExtraBallsStrategy

        public ExtraBallsStrategy​(danogl.collisions.GameObjectCollection gameObjects,
                          BrickerGameManager gameManager)
        Constructor for ExtraBallsStrategy. Sets up the strategy with all required components for adding extra balls.
        Parameters:
        gameObjects - The collection of game objects, used to manage and add new balls within the game.
        gameManager - The game manager, responsible for managing game states and interactions, including the creation of extra balls.

    • Method Detail

      • getTag

        public java.lang.String getTag()
        Returns a unique tag identifying this specific strategy. This tag can be used for debugging or identifying the strategy during the game.
        Specified by:
        getTag in interface CollisionStrategy
        Overrides:
        getTag in class BasicCollisionStrategy
        Returns:
        A string representing the tag of this collision strategy.

      • onCollision

        public void onCollision​(danogl.GameObject thisObj,
                        danogl.GameObject otherObj,
                        danogl.util.Counter bricksCounter,
                        boolean originalBehavior)
        Handles the collision event and adds extra balls to the game. This method is invoked when a collision occurs with an object implementing this strategy. It triggers the creation of additional balls in the game.
        Specified by:
        onCollision in interface CollisionStrategy
        Overrides:
        onCollision in class BasicCollisionStrategy
        Parameters:
        thisObj - The GameObject that this strategy is attached to.
        otherObj - The GameObject that has collided with thisObj.
        bricksCounter - A counter tracking the number of bricks in the game.
        originalBehavior - A boolean flag indicating whether the original behavior of the collision should also occur.
